description: Smallest number whose number of divisors = n-th primorial (A002110).
comments: The n-th term is divisible by the product of first n primorial numbers (A006939(n)), the n-th Chernoff-number. Also the numbers are refactorable (A033950).The formula computes a(n) correctly. [From _T. D. Noe_, May 17 2010]
formula: The n-th term is constructed as a product of special powers of the first n prime, as follows: a(n)=Product[ p(j)^[p(n-j+1)-1] ], j=1...n
author: _Labos Elemer_, May 30 2001
